official-title.#text:
To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to convey a
		  parcel of land in Tuskegee, Alabama, to Tuskegee University, and for other
		  purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text:
In 1922, Tuskegee University voted to
			 donate three hundred acres of land to the United States to build a veterans’
			 hospital, a portion of which is described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and has been used as space
			 for the Tuskegee Veteran’s Hospital.

text.#text:
The property is
			 administered by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to further the education and general welfare of its students.

quote.#tail:
) is a State-related land grant institution
			 of higher learning that intends to use the property described in

text.#text:
Tuskegee University (hereinafter referred
			 to as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the conveyance of the property to the University would promote the
			 University’s educational mission and related purposes and result in savings to
			 the Federal Government.

header.#text:
Land conveyance,
			 Department of Veterans Affairs property, Tuskegee, Alabama

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, without consideration, convey all right, title, and
			 interest of the United States in and to a parcel of real property, including
			 improvements thereon, consisting of approximately 64.5 acres located at 2400
			 Hospital Road, Tuskegee, Alabama, including building numbers 19–29, 50–51,
			 59–60, 62–63, 80, 94, 96, and 124, to Tuskegee University, for the purpose of
			 permitting Tuskegee University to use the property to further the education and
			 general welfare of its students. In carrying out the conveyance under this
			 subsection, the

may survey all or a portion of the property to be
			 conveyed if the

determines such a survey would be necessary or
			 desirable.

shall be only
			 required to meet the disclosure requirements for hazardous substances,
			 pollutants, and contaminants, but otherwise shall not be required to remediate
			 or abate the release of any hazardous substance, pollutant, or contaminant,
			 including petroleum and petroleum derivatives.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 120(h) of the Comprehensive
			 Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980/s:120/ss:h

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in the
			 conveyance of the property under

may
			 enter into leases, contracts, and cooperative agreements with the University
			 related to the conveyance authorized under

text.#text:
In conjunction
			 with, or in addition to, the conveyance under

header.#text:
Leases,
			 contracts, and cooperative agreements authorized

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or any other provision of law, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
division C of subtitle I of title 41,
			 United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may lease real
			 property from the University on a noncompetitive basis.

text.#text:
The authority provided by this subsection is in
			 addition to any other authority of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may require such reasonable terms
